issue.title: Update the pencil icon language
issue.body: As is brought up in [the community forum](https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Learning-Lab/Where-s-the-pencil-icon/m-p/26081#M854), next time we audit this course, we should change the instructions away from "pencil icon" and into something more generic so that it applies to versions of GitHub with the pencil icon and with the `...` hamburger menu.

issue.title: Update the pencil icon language

comment.body: @brianamarie : i accidentally pushed this directly to master, but all i changed was the markdown on two files. do you want to take a quick look and if it's ok, close this issue?  thanks - sorry about that

release.name: v11.1.0
release.body:
### View Course

[Introduction to GitHub](https://lab.github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github)


### Steps

 1. Assign yourself
 2. Turn on GitHub Pages
 3. Close an issue
 4. Create a branch
 5. Commit a file
 6. Open a pull request
 7. Respond to a review
 8. Merge your pull request

### Complete Diff

[`v11.0.0`...`v11.1.0`](https://github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github/compare/v11.0.0...v11.1.0)

commits.message: update pencil icon language

issue.title: Update the pencil icon language
issue.body: As is brought up in [the community forum](https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Learning-Lab/Where-s-the-pencil-icon/m-p/26081#M854), next time we audit this course, we should change the instructions away from "pencil icon" and into something more generic so that it applies to versions of GitHub with the pencil icon and with the `...` hamburger menu.

comment.body:
@lmkeston, this came up from another user. I saw that you were looking for Learning Lab maintenance items. This may be one that is approachable. It would start with finding the response files that mention the "pencil icon". Maybe this could be solved by removing the language describing the button altogether, and adding a note at the bottom of the instructions like:

```
> Note: Can't find the button to edit the file? It may look like a pencil, or it may look like three dots.
```

pull_request.title: Fixing hard-coded org reference
pull_request.body:
`githubtraining` was hard-coded.  This does not make it very friendly to GHES where you can install on any org.  Thank you to @JasonEtco for giving me the proper variable to pull for this.

/cc @crichID @brianamarie @hectorsector @JasonEtco

issue.title: Fixing hard-coded org reference
issue.body:
`githubtraining` was hard-coded.  This does not make it very friendly to GHES where you can install on any org.  Thank you to @JasonEtco for giving me the proper variable to pull for this.

/cc @crichID @brianamarie @hectorsector @JasonEtco

issue.title: Pages URL Not GHES Friendly
issue.body:
The pages URL is hard-coded to only work for .com.   It needs to be corrected for GHES.

https://github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github/blob/master/responses/reminder-delete.md

I don't know the proper variables but it's likely to be something similar to what we do in the scripts for the GitHub for Developers course unless there's a better way that would work for both.  The info is being used in one of the earlier steps as `{{  pagesUrl }}`, but that is passed to the step in question and doesn't seem to persist. 

.com: `https://${CLASS_ORG}.github.io/${REPO_NAME}`
GHES: `https://${ROOT_URL}/pages/${CLASS_ORG}/${REPO_NAME}`

/cc @crichID @brianamarie @hectorsector @JasonEtco

pull_request.title: Fixing hard-coded org reference

issue.title: Course Stuck
issue.body:
## Bug Report

**Current behavior**
I am attempting to take the class using the command line option.  The course seems to be detecting the branch creation, but no action is being taken to move on to the next step.

**Reproduction**
Steps to reproduce the behavior in the course:
1. Start the class with the command line git option.
2. Complete the class through Step 2.
3. After pushing the new branch, nothing happens.

**Expected behavior**
I would expect the course to move on to the next step when the branch is created like stated in the directions.

**Possible solution**
If you have suggestions, we'd love to hear them. If not, that's ok too.

**Additional context**
GHES v2.19.6, LL v0.5.0

Log message from container:

```
15:45:49.625Z  INFO probot: Running step handler for create-a-branch (course_id=8, course_repo=16, course_slug=introduction-to-github, user=<removed>, registration_id=5)
15:45:49.626Z  INFO http: POST / 200 - 43.35 ms (id=94d420f0-482e-11ea-998c-8094e1dfcbe5)
```

/cc @crichID @brianamarie @hectorsector @JasonEtco

comment.body: Thank you to both @crichID and @JasonEtco for their help on this.  It took awhile to get to the bottom of this.  It ended up being user error on my part.  I missed a couple checkboxes when configuring the app initially.  I'm going to go ahead and close this since I was able to successfully complete the course after fixing my settings.

comment.body: Been chatting back and forth with @crichID via Slack on this one.  It works fine on .com.  I can't get this to work at all on on GHES.  I'm fine waiting for the next release and retesting in case this is already addressed there.

comment.body:
I just noticed that I got an email with the following subject after creating the branch:

`Re: [<removed>/github-slideshow] Getting Started with GitHub (#1)`

I think the wrong step might be being triggered.

issue.title: Improvements to course description and meta
issue.body: This PR beefs up the course description and other elements in the course.

comment.body: @hectorsector I went ahead and edited this branch based on @heiskr's advice to leave out certain sections. What do you think?

commits.message: remove unnecessary categories based on @heiskr recommendation

issue.title: Improvements to course description and meta
issue.body: This PR beefs up the course description and other elements in the course.

comment.body:
I think we're going to add these items to the side and automatic, so they don't need to be in this PR:

- Estimated duration
- Course steps
- Getting help
- Keep learning
- Release
- License
